meanings.definition: Submit (a document) for consideration or approval before the official filing date.
meanings.sent1: She prefiled her report to ensure it was reviewed on time.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer prefiled the evidence to prepare for the trial.
meanings.sent3: The student prefiled her homework to impress her teacher.
meanings.sent4: He prefiled his resignation like a chess move, anticipating the next steps.
meanings.sent5: Prefiling the application made the process smoother and faster.

meanings.definition: To file (a document) in advance of the deadline.
meanings.sent1: They prefiled the contract to avoid any last-minute rush.
meanings.sent2: The company prefiled the tax documents to stay organized.
meanings.sent3: The cat prefiled its nap spot before the dog could take it.
meanings.sent4: Prefiling the paperwork was like planting seeds for a successful harvest.
meanings.sent5: Prefiling the forms saved them from the stress of a looming deadline.
